workflow.name: Sync Linear Issues to Todoist Tasks Automatically (Create, Update, Close)
workflow.description:
## ‚ú® Try It Out!
Sync your **Linear issues to Todoist** automatically with this n8n workflow. When an issue is created, updated, or completed in Linear, a corresponding task is created, updated, or closed in Todoist.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

- Triggered by issue changes via `linearTrigger`
- Routes based on action (`create`, `update`, `remove`)
- Checks if a matching Todoist task already exists (via issue ID)
- If the issue has:
  - A **due date**
  - And is assigned to **you** (`youremail@example.com`)  
  ‚û§ Then it creates or updates the task accordingly
- If the issue is marked **Done**, the Todoist task is closed
- If it's deleted in Linear, the Todoist task is also removed
- Sub-issues get enriched with their parent title for clarity

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Customization

- Replace `youremail@example.com` with your **Linear email** in the `IF` nodes
- Adjust which states are synced (e.g. ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äù, ‚ÄúTodo‚Äù...)
- Customize the Todoist project, labels, or title formatting

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Bi-directional Sync?

This workflow is **one-way** (Linear ‚ûú Todoist).  
Bi-directional syncing *might* be possible but isn‚Äôt handled here‚Äîit would be a cool upgrade!

---

## ‚úÖ Requirements

- n8n with OAuth2 access to **Linear** and **Todoist**
- Your **Linear email** set in the workflow for filtering
- A target Todoist project (default: *Inbox*)

---

## üí¨ Need Help?

Ask in the [n8n Forum](https://community.n8n.io/) or join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d).

Happy Automating! üöÄ

parameters.content:
## ‚ú® Try It Out!
Sync your **Linear issues to Todoist** automatically with this n8n workflow. When an issue is created, updated, or completed in Linear, a corresponding task is created, updated, or closed in Todoist.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

- Triggered by issue changes via `linearTrigger`
- Routes based on action (`create`, `update`, `remove`)
- Checks if a matching Todoist task already exists (via issue ID)
- If the issue has:
  - A **due date**
  - And is assigned to **you** (`youremail@example.com`)  
  ‚û§ Then it creates or updates the task accordingly
- If the issue is marked **Done**, the Todoist task is closed
- If it's deleted in Linear, the Todoist task is also removed
- Sub-issues get enriched with their parent title for clarity

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Customization

- Replace `youremail@example.com` with your **Linear email** in the `IF` nodes
- Adjust which states are synced (e.g. ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äù, ‚ÄúTodo‚Äù...)
- Customize the Todoist project, labels, or title formatting

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Bi-directional Sync?

This workflow is **one-way** (Linear ‚ûú Todoist).  
Bi-directional syncing *might* be possible but isn‚Äôt handled here‚Äîit would be a cool upgrade!

---

## ‚úÖ Requirements

- n8n with OAuth2 access to **Linear** and **Todoist**
- Your **Linear email** set in the workflow for filtering
- A target Todoist project (default: *Inbox*)

---

## üí¨ Need Help?

Ask in the [n8n Forum](https://community.n8n.io/) or join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d).

Happy Automating! üöÄ

## 1. Listen for Linear Issue Events
[Learn more about the Linear Trigger node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/linear/)

This node captures events from Linear like issue creation, update, or removal‚Äîit's the starting point of our workflow.

## 2. Route by Action: Create, Update or Remove
[See how Switch nodes work](https://docs.n8n.io/nodes/n8n-nodes-base.switch/)

Based on the type of action (`create`, `update`, or `remove`), we branch into different flows. Each one handles the task accordingly in Todoist.

## 3. Check for Existing Task in Todoist
[Explore Todoist Node Docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/todoist/)

Before creating or updating anything, we check if a task for the Linear issue already exists in Todoist‚Äîusing a custom search on the issue ID. This helps avoid duplicates.

## 5. Handle Sub-Issues with Context
[Example: Fetching Parent Data](https://docs.n8n.io/nodes/n8n-nodes-base.linear/)

If the Linear issue is a sub-task, we fetch the parent issue's title and combine both to generate a meaningful task name in Todoist like:  
`[Parent] ‚Üí Sub-Issue`.

## 4. Conditional Logic for Updates or Completion
[Learn about IF & Switch nodes](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/expressions/conditions/)

We make sure the issue:
- Has a due date
- Is assigned to *you*
- Is not already completed (or should be marked done in Todoist if the issue is finished)

This logic helps filter out irrelevant or already-completed issues. You can customize this to your needs.

## 6. Create, Update or Close Todoist Tasks
[Todoist Integration Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/todoist/)

Finally, based on the logic above, we either:
- Create a new task in your Todoist project
- Update an existing task with new title, description, or due date
- Close the task if the Linear issue is marked as "Done"

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
